According to Wang Fengyang's research, " ice " refers to a solid formed by condensation of water. " Ling " is ice that has been chiseled out or stored for later use. The two have similar meanings but are different. "Beginner's Notes": "Ice accumulation becomes Ling." "Ice accumulation" means ice in storage. "poetry. Bin Feng. "July": "On the second day, the ice will be cut and charged, and the third day will be received in Lingyin." The place where the ice is stored is called "Lingyin." "Han Shu. "Cheng Di Ji": "The first month of the first year of Yongshi's Spring Festival is Gui Chou, the imperial official Lingshi is on fire." "Lingshi" is the ice cellar. In modern times, ice accretion is also called " ling ". " Lingxun " on the Yellow River refers to the flooding of rivers caused by the formation of ice ridges (that is, the rivers that melted in the upper reaches of the ice and snow, while the lower reaches of the river have not thawed). Hidden ice is called " ling " because most of the ice cut is square ice with sharp edges and corners. Therefore, all kinds of ice, especially those with square, diamond, and block shapes, are often called " ling " (Wang Fengyang) .

"Said Wen": "𣎎 (𠗲), come out. From 廌, I sound. "Poetry" says: "In 𠗲yin." Ling, 𠗲 or from 夌." Duan Yucai: "Anyone, It is said that the hydrology is sharp and sharp." "The poem "Bin": "Three days are in Lingyin", the "Biography" says: "Lingyin, the ice room." This releases the yin with ice, and releases the yin with the room. It’s not that 𠗲 is the room. Zheng said in "Zhou Li. Lingren": "Ling, the ice room." It seems to be lost."

" Ling " was later borrowed to express bullying, bullying, and leapfrogging.

Bronze inscriptions are used as a surname, and Yu Bo said: "Yi Bai (Bo) Zha (Zuo) Bao Yi", which means that Yu Bo has cast precious bronze wares.

The Han silk book borrows " Ling " to mean " Ling ", referring to Bing, "Mawangdui silk book. Lao Zi Jia Ben: "Hua Qi Ruo Ling Ze", Wang Bi's "Lao Zi" is "Huan Xi Ruo Bing Zhi Shi", which means fusion and amiable, like icicles melting (Chen Guying).

humanum_full_description:
金文從「仌」從「夌」，「仌」、「夌」皆是聲符，「仌」亦是意符，象冰粒之形。本義是被人鑿出來的冰（王鳳陽）。

　　根據王鳳陽的研究，「冰」指水凝結而成的固體。「凌」是被人鑿出來的冰或鑿取後儲藏備用的積冰。二者義近而有別。《初學記》：「積冰為凌」。「積冰」即儲藏之冰。《詩．豳風．七月》：「二之日鑿冰沖沖，三之日納于凌陰。」儲冰之處稱為「凌陰」。《漢書．成帝紀》：「永始元年春正月癸丑，太官凌室火。」「凌室」即冰窖。現代還把積冰稱「凌」，黃河上的「凌汛」即謂積冰形成冰垻導致的河水泛濫（即是指上游冰雪融化，而下游尚未解凍所形成的河水猛漲）。藏冰稱為「凌」，是因為所鑿之冰多為棱角分明的方形冰的緣故，因此，各種冰，尤其形狀呈方形、菱形以及各種塊狀的冰，多稱「凌」（王鳳陽）。

　　《說文》：「𣎎（𠗲），仌出也。从仌，朕聲。《詩》曰：『納于𠗲陰。』凌，𠗲或从夌。」段玉裁：「仌出者，謂仌之出水文棱棱然。」「《豳》詩：『三之日納于凌陰』，《傳》曰：『凌陰，冰室也。』此以冰釋凌，以室釋陰。非謂𠗲爲仌室也。鄭注《周禮．凌人》徑云：『凌，冰室也。』似失之。」

　　「凌」後被借來表示欺凌、凌駕、跨越等義。

　　金文用作姓氏，夌伯觶：「夌白（伯）乍（作）寶彝」，意謂夌伯鑄造了寶貴的青銅器。

　　漢帛書借「淩」來表示「凌」，指冰，《馬王堆帛書．老子甲本》：「渙呵其若淩澤」，王弼本《老子》作「渙兮若冰之將釋」，意謂融和可親啊，像冰柱消融（陳鼓應）。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「仌」從「夌」，「仌」、「夌」皆是聲符。本義是被人鑿出來的冰（王鳳陽）。後借來表示凌越、欺凌。
